data.scheme_name: QRMP - Quarterly Returns with Monthly Payment Scheme - Existing
data.benefits:
1. Under the QRMP scheme, taxpayers file GSTR-1 and GSTR-3B only once per quarter, reducing the frequency of compliance. 
  2. The QRMP scheme allows two options for monthly tax payment: 
    • Fixed Sum Method: Pre-filled challan based on 35% of the tax liability from the previous quarter (for quarterly filers) or the previous month (for monthly filers). 
    • Self-Assessment Method: Payment based on actual tax liability after adjusting Input Tax Credit (ITC). 
  3. Taxpayers can opt into or out of the scheme on a quarterly basis, but this choice must be exercised within a specific time window at the start of the quarter. 
  4. Taxpayers can use the Invoice Furnishing Facility (IFF) to upload invoices for the first two months of a quarter. 
  5. This helps pass on Input Tax Credit to recipients without waiting for quarterly filings. 
  6. Reduce compliance costs by decreasing return filing frequency, though monthly tax payment remains necessary for accurate liability tracking.
data.eligibility:
1. Taxpayers with an aggregate turnover of up to Rs. 500 Lakhs in the preceding financial year are eligible to opt for the QRMP scheme. 
  2. Existing taxpayers must have filed their last due Form GSTR-3B return to be eligible for opting into the scheme. 
  3. It is valid for taxpayers required to file Form GSTR-1 and Form GSTR-3B. 
  4. Newly registered taxpayers applying as normal taxpayers are also eligible under the section.
data.conditions:
1. Taxpayer must be registered as a regular taxpayer or opted out of composition scheme. Taxpayer must have a valid User ID and password. 
  2. Taxpayers who wish to opt for the QRMP scheme must ensure that no data has been saved or submitted in Form GSTR-1 for the applicable quarter before opting for the scheme. 
  3. Taxpayer must not have defaulted in filing GST returns or in payment of tax

data.context:
• The section was introduced to ease GST compliance, especially for Micro enterprises, reducing their filing obligations and enhancing liquidity. 
  • It was a part of the government's initiative to simplify the GST framework and encourage compliance.
data.objective: To simplify GST compliance for small and medium taxpayers by reducing the frequency of return filing while ensuring regular tax payments.

data.how_to_apply:
1. Eligible taxpayers can opt for QRMP through the GST portal. 
  2. The option can be exercised for a particular quarter between the 1st day of the second month of the preceding quarter and the last day of the first month of the quarter.
data.funding_facilitator: Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs
data.additional_info:
• Taxpayers can opt out of the QRMP scheme and file GSTR-1 and GSTR-3B on a monthly basis, or remain in the scheme to file both forms quarterly. 
  • Opting in or out can be done via the GST portal by navigating to Services > Returns > Opt-in for Quarterly Return. 
  • The QRMP scheme can be opted for or exited during the timelines below: Qtr 1: 1st Feb – 30th Apr Qtr 2: 1st May – 31st Jul Qtr 3: 1st Aug – 31st Oct Qtr 4: 1st Nov – 31st Jan Tax payments for the first two months of a quarter are due by the 25th of the next month. 
  • GSTR-3B must be filed by the 22nd/24th of the month following the quarter, depending on the state.
